title: amicrypto
author: amicrypto
content: Hi, using this portal as I am not left with any options. I am looking to close a P2P trade in India, Bangalore. Real-time transaction and I can come down to a mutually agreed place. I can pay in any of the cryptos that the trader wants - can take the amount in UPI.Looking for trustworthy folks - having a +ve trust score helps.On the conversion rates: I will give a discount of 1% on the INR/USDT/other crypto priced from the last transaction on WazirX/CoinDCX.

comments.author: amicrypto
comments.body: I see no interest in the community. I am relatively new to the P2P space (using WazirX earlier), what are the best places to get P2P trade done in India without any KYC?

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: Quote from: amicrypto on May 24, 2022, 05:06:41 AMI see no interest in the community. I am relatively new to the P2P space (using WazirX earlier), what are the best places to get P2P trade done in India without any KYC?I did some research about it earlier and found that local crypto and Paxful allow withdrawal in INR without KYC but beware of scammers on local crypto. I am not sure whether they are still allowing now. You can do a check now and can inform us.

comments.author: ajaxtempest
comments.body: Quote from: amicrypto on May 24, 2022, 05:06:41 AMI see no interest in the community. I am relatively new to the P2P space (using WazirX earlier), what are the best places to get P2P trade done in India without any KYC?use bisqhttps://bisq.network/

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: Quote from: ajaxtempest on May 25, 2022, 10:03:24 AMQuote from: amicrypto on May 24, 2022, 05:06:41 AMI see no interest in the community. I am relatively new to the P2P space (using WazirX earlier), what are the best places to get P2P trade done in India without any KYC?use bisqhttps://bisq.network/Bisq is DEX for Bitcoin and if I am correct it doesn't support INR transaction. It only support dollar and few other global currencies. Anyways whatever you do to avoid the TAX will come back to you so hold if possible or pay TAX as per the law.

comments.author: ajaxtempest
comments.body: Quote from: pakhitheboss on May 25, 2022, 12:08:10 PMQuote from: ajaxtempest on May 25, 2022, 10:03:24 AMQuote from: amicrypto on May 24, 2022, 05:06:41 AMI see no interest in the community. I am relatively new to the P2P space (using WazirX earlier), what are the best places to get P2P trade done in India without any KYC?use bisqhttps://bisq.network/Bisq is DEX for Bitcoin and if I am correct it doesn't support INR transaction. It only support dollar and few other global currencies. Anyways whatever you do to avoid the TAX will come back to you so hold if possible or pay TAX as per the law. Are you smoking?Have you tried bisq recently? THey support imps\neft\rtgs

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: Quote from: ajaxtempest on May 26, 2022, 06:04:43 AMQuote from: pakhitheboss on May 25, 2022, 12:08:10 PMQuote from: ajaxtempest on May 25, 2022, 10:03:24 AMQuote from: amicrypto on May 24, 2022, 05:06:41 AMI see no interest in the community. I am relatively new to the P2P space (using WazirX earlier), what are the best places to get P2P trade done in India without any KYC?use bisqhttps://bisq.network/Bisq is DEX for Bitcoin and if I am correct it doesn't support INR transaction. It only support dollar and few other global currencies. Anyways whatever you do to avoid the TAX will come back to you so hold if possible or pay TAX as per the law. Are you smoking?Have you tried bisq recently? THey support imps\neft\rtgsOkay!I did a check and found out you are correct it does support IMPS and UPI transfer. I am not sure when did they started supporting indian payment methods but previously it was not there.

comments.author: ajaxtempest
comments.body: The sad thing is that it is not well known in India. I think bisq introduced indian payments in sep last year. Teh beauty of using bisq is that the govt does not know if you bought or sold BTC!however if your yearly tx goes above 10 lakh  then IT dept might send notice asking you how you got so much money from whom and the reason.ps: to be more secure connect bisq with your bitcoin core software.never sell BTC and hodl as in 10 years 1 btc might go million dollars.

comments.author: bitterbit
comments.body: Bisq withdrawals come from bisq corporate account or someone another person using the same trading platform?

comments.author: ajaxtempest
comments.body: Quote from: bitterbit on May 27, 2022, 04:19:06 PMBisq withdrawals come from bisq corporate account or someone another person using the same trading platform?no its a non custodial wallet like electrum with p2p and tor relay.https://bisq.wiki/Frequently_asked_questions

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Quote from: amicrypto on May 21, 2022, 09:20:04 AMHi, using this portal as I am not left with any options. I am looking to close a P2P trade in India, Bangalore. Real-time transaction and I can come down to a mutually agreed place. I can pay in any of the cryptos that the trader wants - can take the amount in UPI.Looking for trustworthy folks - having a +ve trust score helps.On the conversion rates: I will give a discount of 1% on the INR/USDT/other crypto priced from the last transaction on WazirX/CoinDCX.May I know why aren't you left with any other option? We have localbitcoins or Bisq available for p2p trading. You can also use Wazirx to convert your bitcoins to INR. You can use Coinswitch to sell your coins etc. You have multiple options available. So it's really important to know why aren't you left with any other options? It's extremely difficult to make someone interested into meet and trade. Localbitcoins had such functionality available but now they have stopped.

I can pay in any of the cryptos that the trader wants - can take the amount in UPI.Looking for trustworthy folks - having a +ve trust score helps.On the conversion rates: I will give a discount of 1% on the INR/USDT/other crypto priced from the last transaction on WazirX/CoinDCX.May I know why aren't you left with any other option? We have localbitcoins or Bisq available for p2p trading. You can also use Wazirx to convert your bitcoins to INR. You can use Coinswitch to sell your coins etc. You have multiple options available. So it's really important to know why aren't you left with any other options? It's extremely difficult to make someone interested into meet and trade. Localbitcoins had such functionality available but now they have stopped. OP is trying avoid KYC you can check this reply Quote from: amicrypto on May 24, 2022, 05:06:41 AMI see no interest in the community. I am relatively new to the P2P space (using WazirX earlier), what are the best places to get P2P trade done in India without any KYC?If I am correct localbitcoin, WazirX and Coinswitch will ask for KYC. Therefore only Bisq can be used and it has started supporting INR payments.

comments.author: aquafinewater
comments.body: Hi  I,m using binance for p2p because binance give best features and also allow in mostly countries so this is the best way for p2p and we can easily exchange dollar or any other cryptocurrency in our own currency

comments.author: Aryan058
comments.body: The P2P trade is the best way to exchange your asset in your own currency in india or other countries. I used binance P2P trade it is  very good and ultra fast .

comments.author: IIrik11
comments.body: here is bisq marketplace report for inr:https://bisq.markets/market/btc_inri have tried to buy bitcoin using bisq several times but there aren't any sellers who use the platform.and that is basically what you'll see at every non-kyc marketplace.people worried about receiving bad money in their account and rightly so.if you do find a seller or 2 you'll notice they selling for price way higher than the market price.

comments.author: elevates
comments.body: Quote from: IIrik11 on October 09, 2022, 12:48:56 PMhere is bisq marketplace report for inr:https://bisq.markets/market/btc_inri have tried to buy bitcoin using bisq several times but there aren't any sellers who use the platform.and that is basically what you'll see at every non-kyc marketplace.people worried about receiving bad money in their account and rightly so.if you do find a seller or 2 you'll notice they selling for price way higher than the market price.Bisq is great! I mean they have Bitcoin to INR transaction available, wherein there isn't a single transaction happening as most indian crypto community is still going for the government control exchange. I would not blame them as Bisq desktop app struggle to get connected and then if it does get connected you need to follow a hell of procedures. I tried it once and it continues to show me the same error message, that was unable to connect. I recommend holding on till a new tax law is passed. I also know there are many in this forum earning their livelihood.

comments.author: IIrik11
comments.body: Quote from: elevates on October 09, 2022, 02:56:02 PMQuote from: IIrik11 on October 09, 2022, 12:48:56 PMhere is bisq marketplace report for inr:https://bisq.markets/market/btc_inri have tried to buy bitcoin using bisq several times but there aren't any sellers who use the platform.and that is basically what you'll see at every non-kyc marketplace.people worried about receiving bad money in their account and rightly so.if you do find a seller or 2 you'll notice they selling for price way higher than the market price.Bisq is great! I mean they have Bitcoin to INR transaction available, wherein there isn't a single transaction happening as most indian crypto community is still going for the government control exchange. I would not blame them as Bisq desktop app struggle to get connected and then if it does get connected you need to follow a hell of procedures. I tried it once and it continues to show me the same error message, that was unable to connect. I recommend holding on till a new tax law is passed. I also know there are many in this forum earning their livelihood. have u seen the prices at the non-kyc exchanges?each and every one of them is selling at 25% above market price.no one is ever going to buy that.so, it comes down to either u pay ridiculous amount to buy.or u let exchanges sell ur personal data and u become a target for the govt.either way ur fu**ed!!
